Questions.QuestionString: 1. What is the colour of the band on a hydraulic seal?. (Level 1)
2. A check flow valve in a hydraulic system prevents. (Level 1)
3. During a leak test of an hydraulic system, system pressure. (Level 1)
4. Mechanical sequence valves are operated by. (Level 1)
Answers: C. the operation of a NRV.

Questions.QuestionString: 5. An automatic cut-out valve will. (Level 1)
Answers: B. prevent the hydraulic lock forming.

Questions.QuestionString: 6. A thermal relief valve. (Level 1)
Answers: C. provides cooling for the fluid.

Questions.QuestionString: 7. Phosphate Ester hydraulic fluid requires which kind of seals?. (Level 1)
8. Hand pumps in hydraulic systems are normally. (Level 1)
9. The force exerted by a hydraulic cylinder is equal to. (Level 1)
10. A tandem PFCU. (Level 1)
Answers: A. has two control surfaces under its control.
C. has the actuator rams co-axial.

Questions.QuestionString: 11. What happens to hydraulic fluid when it is overheated?. (Level 1)
12. How do you prevent hydraulic fluid frothing?. (Level 1)
13. Synthetic hydraulic fluid subjected to overheating is high in. (Level 1)
14. Hydraulic systems normally operate at. (Level 1)
15. When replacing a flexible pipe. (Level 1)
Answers: C. use two spanners to stop pipe from twisting.

Questions.QuestionString: 16. How do you remove air from hydraulic fluid?. (Level 1)
17. A constant delivery pump has its output varied with. (Level 1)
18. A variable angled pump starts at. (Level 1)
19. Hydraulic pressure can be restored by. (Level 2)
Answers: A. compressing the air charge in an accumulator.
B. the use of a pressure/heat exchanger.
C. compressing the fluid in a reservoir.

Questions.QuestionString: 20. Where is the temperature overheat switch located in a hydraulic pump?. (Level 2)
21. What happens if a component has an internal hydraulic leak?. (Level 2)
22. Accumulators as fitted to aircraft hydraulic systems. (Level 2)
Answers: A. are only ever used in an emergency.
C. provide additional fluid if leaks occur.

Questions.QuestionString: 23. A Skydrol hydraulic fluid seal would be made of. (Level 2)
Answers: C. butyl rubber, ethylene propylene or Teflon.

Questions.QuestionString: 24. The control of hydraulically powered emergency electrical generator frequency is by. (Level 2)
25. When flushing hydraulic systems. (Level 2)
Answers: B. flush with any hydraulic oil.
C. flush with same hydraulic oil.

Questions.QuestionString: 26. When replenishing a hydraulic system. (Level 2)
Answers: B. use any hydraulic fluid made by the same manufacturer.
C. use the same/correct hydraulic fluid.

Questions.QuestionString: 27. When is an hydraulic de-pressurising valve energised?. (Level 2)
Answers: B. When there is sufficient hydraulic pressure available.

Questions.QuestionString: 28. What constitutes a hydraulic power pack?. (Level 2)
Answers: B. Reservoir, pump, selector valve, filter.

Questions.QuestionString: 29. If an accumulator loses air pressure there will be. (Level 2)
30. A thermal relief valve is fitted to an hydraulic system to. (Level 2)
Answers: A. prevent a leak back of pressure.

Questions.QuestionString:
31. A component in a hydraulic system which ensures instantaneous action when a service is
selected is. (Level 2)
32. Restrictor valves in an hydraulic system are used to. (Level 2)
Answers: A. restrict the rate of pressure build up.
B. control the rate of system operation.

Questions.QuestionString: 33. The purpose of a mechanical sequence valve is to ensure the operation of. (Level 2)
34. The purpose of a non-return valve is to. (Level 2)
Answers: A. direct fluid to the hydraulic actuator.
B. restrict the movement of components.
C. isolate one component from another.

Questions.QuestionString: 35. The end fittings on a NRV are normally different to. (Level 2)
Answers: A. facilitate bleeding of the system.
B. allow a full flow from the valve.

Questions.QuestionString: 36. Automatic cut-out valve hammering is caused by. (Level 2)
Answers: C. relief valve set too high.

Questions.QuestionString: 37. Hand pumps are normally single cylinder double acting because of the. (Level 2)
38. Pressure relay valves are fitted. (Level 2)
Answers: B. before a pressure sequence valve.
C. before a pressure relief valve.

Questions.QuestionString: 39. Hydraulic reservoirs are pressurized to. (Level 2)
Answers: A. provide a reserve of stored energy.
B. maintain a constant fluid level.
C. minimize the possibility of pump cavitation.

Questions.QuestionString: 40. In aircraft hydraulic systems, it is permissible to use. (Level 2)
Answers: B. any fluid of the same specific gravity.

Questions.QuestionString: 41. Hydraulic systems are normally flushed with. (Level 2)
Answers: B. the same type of fluid as used in the system.

Questions.QuestionString: 42. A RAT hydraulic pump is for. (Level 2)
Answers: A. landing gear and auto-brake systems.
C. flying controls if hydraulic power lost.

Questions.QuestionString: 43. A purpose of a 'cut-out' in a hydraulic system. (Level 3)
Answers: A. is to prevent creep in jack operated services which have several selected positions.
B. is to limit loss of fluid in the event of pipe fracture.

C. is to relieve the pump of load when the operation of services is complete and the accumulator
charged with fluid.

Questions.QuestionString: 44. A maintainer valve in an hydraulic system will. (Level 3)
Answers: A. allow continued press to essential systems during times of reduced supply.
C. maintain a high pressure to all systems.

Questions.QuestionString: 45. How is the hydraulic pump depressurising solenoid actuated?. (Level 3)
Answers: A. Energised both open and closed depending on cockpit selection.

Questions.QuestionString: 46. A normal hydraulic system will. (Level 3)
Answers: A. show pressure and source of hydraulics.
B. show fluid temperature and quantity.
C. illuminate a light in the cockpit when the system is ready.

Questions.QuestionString:
47. A constant volume hydraulic system uses what to relieve pressure in system when no services
are being used?. (Level 3)
Answers: B. Return line back to pump.

Questions.QuestionString: 48. A pressure control relay in a hydraulic pump is. (Level 3)
Answers: A. energised to the run position.
B. used to prevent anything happening until there is hydraulic pressure.
C. de-energised to start the pump.

Questions.QuestionString: 49. A duplex seal consist of. (Level 3)
Answers: A. a square section rubber ring within a steel washer.
B. a hard rubber square section ring with a soft rubber square section inner ring.
C. a rubber 'T' section ring sandwiched between two Teflon rings.

Questions.QuestionString: 50. A fixed volume axial pump contains the following rotating parts. (Level 3)
Answers: A. Drive Shaft, Swash Plate & Valve Block.
C. Drive Shaft, Swash Plate & Cylinder Block.

Questions.QuestionString: 51. An hydraulic closed system is one where. (Level 3)
Answers: A. pressure is maintained at the selector valves at all times.
B. there is no pressure at the selector valves when no functions are required.
C. most of the major components of the system are included in a self contained unit.

Questions.QuestionString: 52. A marker number on a pipe indicates. (Level 3)
Answers: A. the thickness of the wall on the pipe.
B. the specification of the pipe throughout the pipe run.
C. the type of fluid used to pressure test the pipe.

Questions.QuestionString: 53. "One reason for fitting an accumulator in an hydraulic system is to." (Level 3)
Answers: A. minimize the possibility of pump cavitation.

Questions.QuestionString: 54. A shuttle valve is used for. (Level 3)
Answers: A. preventing fluid loss from a leaking jack.
B. maintaining fluid press when the emergency system fails.
C. change over from main to auxiliary system in the case of failure.

Questions.QuestionString:
55. A hydraulic accumulator is charged with initial air pressure of 1000 PSI. When the hydraulic
system pressure of 3000 PSI is reached, the air pressure is. (Level 3)
56. Constant delivery hydraulic pumps. (Level 3)
Answers: A. require an automatic cut-out valve in the system.
B. require an automatic cut-out valve and accumulator in the system.

Questions.QuestionString: 57. Before checking the initial pressure in the hydraulic accumulator. (Level 3)
Answers: A. the reservoir must be checked for correct level.
B. the fluid pressure must be released.
C. all air must be bled from the system.

Questions.QuestionString: 58. The essential components of a hydraulic system of the constant delivery type are an. (Level 3)
Answers: A. accumulator and automatic cut-out valve.

Questions.QuestionString: 59. A maintaining valve is fitted to a hydraulic system. (Level 3)
Answers: A. to maintain a back pressure to the accumulator.
B. relieve excessive pressure to return.
C. to ensure a supply of fluid to essential services in the event of system failure.

Questions.QuestionString:
60. To enable an hydraulic system to operate two components requiring different pressures. (Level
3)
Answers: A. a pressure reducing valve is used.
B. a pressure regulating valve is used.
C. a pressure relief valve is used.

Questions.QuestionString:
61. How many type of hydraulic pressure?
1. Hydrostatic pressure.
2. Hydrodynamic pressure.
3. Ambient air pressure.
62. What color for hydraulic Mineral oil?
63. What color for hydraulic synthetic oil?
64. Can we mix the mineral oil to synthetic oil?
65. Can we mix some kind of the synthetic oils together?
Answers: C. Can but need add additives compound

Questions.QuestionString: 66. What should you do if hydraulic spilled on the wheel?
Answers: C. Clean with soap and water immediately

Questions.QuestionString:
67. Which are the characteristics of hydraulic oil?
1. Low flammability.
2. Good lubricating quality.
3. Resistance to freezing.
4. Non evaporating.
5. Chemical stability.
6. Hydroscopic quality.
68. Can we use any kind of seals for the same job?
Answers: B. Can with the same PN or interchange PN
C. Depend on size and shape of seal

Questions.QuestionString: 69. Which component distributes the same hydraulic pressure to many users
70. In large A/C, normally has 2 or 3 hydraulic systems, are they independent system?
Answers: A. Yes, they are independent systems
B. No, they are dependent system

Questions.QuestionString: 71. In large A/C, normally has 2 or 3 hydraulic systems, do they use the same reservoir tank?
Answers: B. No, its own reservoir for each hyd system

Questions.QuestionString: 72. How much air pressure for reservoir pressurization?

73. How can you de-pressurize the hydraulic reservoir before changing the components in hyd
system?
Answers: A. Active the de-pressurization valve at the GND service panel
B. Shut off the air pressure supply to reservoir
C. Active the de-pressurization valve on the top of the reservoir

Questions.QuestionString: 74. What type of hyd. Pump used for hydraulic system in the modern Airplane?
75. How many type of piston pump normally using in hyd system?
Answers: A. One is a variable displacement pump
B. One is a Fixed displacement pump
C. 2 types of piston pump: fixed and variable displacement

Questions.QuestionString: 76. What is the EDP in hyd system?
